title: Emma Stone channels 1920s glamour in grey velvet at Jennifer Lawrence's wedding in Rhode Island
text:
Jennifer Lawrence walked down the aisle Saturday, marrying Cooke Maroney at the beautiful Belcourt Castle in Newport, Rhode Island.

Such an event could only come with a truly star-studded guest list, with the couple's friends including the likes of Kris Jenner, Amy Schumer, Adele, Sienna Miller, Cameron Diaz and Ashley Olsen.

Also in attendance was Lawrence's pal Emma Stone, who channeled 1920s glamour with her chic look.

'20s glam: Emma Stone channeled 1920s glamour Saturday with her chic look at pal Jennifer Lawrence's Rhode Island wedding

The 30-year-old stepped out of her town car in an stunning grey velvet cowl neck dress.

It was paired with a matching ankle-length overcoat, for a classic and timeless aesthetic.

She completed the look with some pearl teardrop earrings and a pair of strappy jeweled six-inch stilettos.

The La La Land actress wore her gorgeous red hair swept into a loose, but refined updo.

Velvet chic: The 30-year-old stepped out of her town car in an impossibly stunning grey velvet cowl neck dress

Timeless beauty: It was paired with a matching ankle-length overcoat, for a classic and timeless aesthetic

Lawrence has been friends with Stone for quite some time, even interviewing her last year for her Elle cover.

Stone said: 'You’ve been one of my most loyal friends for years. And I think knowing that you can laugh together and that not everything has to be such a big deal [is important].'

Lawrence told Vanity Fair they were introduced by Woody Harrelson, with whom she starred in Hunger Games, and with whom Stone recently reunited in Zombieland: Double Tap.

Gal pals: Lawrence has been friends with Stone for quite some time, even interviewing her last year for her Elle cover; they are seen here in 2017

Mutual co-star: Lawrence told Vanity Fair they were introduced by Woody Harrelson, with whom she starred in Hunger Games, and with whom Stone recently reunited in Zombieland: Double Tap; here they are pictured last year at the Oscars

So it's a no-brainer that she'd be at Lawrence's wedding to the art gallery director, after the couple got engaged in February.

Lawrence opened up about her engagement on the podcast Naked with Catt Sadler: 'I definitely wasn't at a place where I was like, "I'm ready to get married." I just met Cooke and I wanted to marry him. We wanted to marry each other.

'We wanted to commit fully. He's my best friend so I want to legally bind him to me forever. And fortunately the paperwork exists for such a thing. It's the greatest. You find your favorite person in the planet and you're like you can't leave. So I wanted to take that offer.'

Fairytale wedding: The star-studded ceremony took place Saturday at Belcourt Castle in Newport, Rhode Island

Who is Cooke Maroney? All about Jennifer Lawrence's art dealer love New love: Jennifer Lawrence is seen with Cooke Maroney in New York back in June 2018 on one of their first dates Jennifer Lawrence has dated a string of stars, from Coldplay's Chris Martin to actor Nicholas Hoult and director Darren Aronofsky. But unlike her famous exes the newlywed's brand new husband, Cooke Maroney, is no celebrity - with the 34-year-old working as an art dealer in New York City. Here we look at what is known about the new Mr Jennifer Lawrence. Maroney was born in New York to parents, Suki Fredericks and James Maroney, an art dealer in Manhattan who previously served as the Head of American Paintings at Christie's. In 1986 the two decided to move the family to Vermont to raise the toddler Cooke and his younger sister Annabelle in a more simplistic way. The brother and sister grew up on the 750 acre organic Oliver Hill Farm in Leicester, Vermont, just outside of Middlebury. Their parents still live on the farm today, hosting weddings and letting out a three-bedroom guest house through AirBnB - on which they are superhosts. Suki writes on the site: 'We've been on our farm since 1986, moving up from NYC, fortunate to have raised our kids and stewarded various animals and the land organically. It is a wonderful place to live and to visit.' The farm has cows grazing on the fields, free-range hens clucking around the orchards and is near trails, and a river and reservoir. After graduating from high school in Vermont, Cooke went to New York University. Today Cooke is the director of the high-end Gladstone 64 Gallery in New York City. Falling in love: The couple are seen kissing in November last year at an ice hockey match in New York Wedding planning: Jennifer and Cooke are seen in May this year A regular at swanky art exhibitions in the Big Apple, he formerly worked for the Gagosian gallery. In his post at the venerated Gotham art gallery, Maroney worked alongside noted artists including Carroll Dunham (who is Lena Dunham‘s father), Anish Kapoor, and Matthew Barney, the ex of Bjork. It is not known how Cooke and Lawrence first met, with initial reports that they were introduced by her friend Laura Simpson described as 'erroneous' by a source. Soon to wed: The pair enjoy a date on October 10
